results.title: Video and Animation Workshops 2006
results.brief_description: A selection of video and animated works created by young students from different schools in various ACMI Workshops during 2006, including “Scratch it”, “Digital Poetry”, and “Claymation”. Also includes two untitled abstract animated works.

results.title: Super Penguin
results.brief_description: A short film made in a one-day ACMI Claymation workshop where students are taught the basics of stop motion animation using modelling clay, a digital video camera and editing software. They also create an original soundtrack for their film

results.title: Sunday bloody Sunday
results.creator_credit: John Schlesinger, Joseph Janni and Vectia Films
results.brief_description: Glenda Jackson, a career woman separated from her husband, and Peter Finch, a Jewish doctor, are caught in a love triangle with a young bisexual designer. Although the arrangement appears ideal, the trio must deal with the jealousy, fear and self doubt they encounter. This absorbing character study, originally shocking, is regarded as a forerunner of cinema’s increasingly mature treatment of homosexuality. Also stars Peggy Ashcroft.

results.title: Super size me
results.creator_credit: Morgan Spurlock, The Con, Showtime Independent, Samuel Goldwyn Films and Roadside Attractions
results.brief_description: Eating nothing but McDonald’s for one month, Morgan Spurlock discovers the effects of fast-food first-hand. Under medical supervision, he proves by his experiment that junk food does make you sick - and while it is a bit extreme to eat “Maccas” three meals a day, the film shows how American society is making itself unwell by eating fast food in great amounts and that obesity is one of the largest causes of illness and death in the country. The “Super Size” refers to the larger sizes on offer and Morgan makes the rule that when offered a Super Size he must eat it! Winner of Best Director 2004 Sundance Film Festival.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Morgan Spurlock, The Con, Showtime Independent, Samuel Goldwyn Films and Roadside Attractions

results.title: Sunday
results.creator_credit: Chris Backhouse and South Australian Film Corporation
results.brief_description: A clay animated short film where two gentlemen transform their lounge room into a ballet stage. While one plays the harp, the other one dons a tutu and dances to Beethoven’s “Fur Elise”. This simple Australian short is delightful and mischievous.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Chris Backhouse and South Australian Film Corporation

results.title: Sunbury
results.creator_credit: John Dixon and Cambridge Film Production
results.brief_description: The Sunbury Music Festival, held each Australia Day between 1972 and 1975 holds fond memories for the 35,000 plus people who attended. This video shows highlights of the first festival in 1972 and captures the excitement of a festival which showcased Australian Rock music and provides a document of Australian society in the seventies.
